_header: In a noon tide of a summers day

OxfBal354.First Lines:
In a tyme of a somers dayThe sune shon full meryly þat
                    tyde…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…& ofte to fall in wykyd thowghtAnd than ys best
                        Revertere

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
yn a noone hete of somerdayThe sone schone full mery that
                    tyde…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…And ofte to fall yn wykkyd sorteThen ys the beste
                    keuertere

Lam853.First Lines:
IN noon tyd of asomers dayÞe sunne schoon ful myrei þat
                    tideI took myn hauk al for to playMi spaynel rennyng bi my
                    side…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Þerfore pray we to heuene kijngEuery man in his
                    degreeeTo graunte them þe blis euerlastingeÞat þis word
                    weel kan seie reuertere
Lam853.Note:
Written as prose. Quire [6] bound before Quire [5], which page numbering
                    takes into account.

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
